title: Woolworths appoints supermarkets stalwart as new BWS boss
text:
Woolworths has appointed a 15-year veteran of its supermarkets business to run beer wine and spirits chain BWS.

The move comes six weeks before shareholders are due to vote on the first stage of a restructure that will ultimately lead to a demerger of the company's hotel, gaming and liquor interests.

Scott Davidson takes the helm of BWS from Guy Brent, who was appointed managing director of Woolworths' FoodCo and Metro convenience store division in July 2019.

Woolworths has appointed Scott Davidson as managing director of liquor chain BWS. Supplied

Mr Davidson is currently general manager of buying and merchandise for Woolworths' New Zealand supermarket chain, Countdown, a role he has held since January 2018.

Over the last 15 years he has held a variety of roles with Woolworths in Australia including head of produce, head of trade for packaged and international food, and merchandise/business manager for grocery, private label, pet needs and hotels.
description: Scott Davidson, a 15-year food and grocery veteran, takes the helm of BWS from Guy Brent in January.
